original: Åkerman, Karl Helge, redaktion|ssekreterare, Västervik, f. 17/12/96 i Västervik av Carl Å. o. Kristina An-dersdotter. G. 26 m. Eva Risberg. Barn : Karl f. 27, Petter 28, Kristina 31, Elisabet 42, Nils 44, Lars 47. — Re-alex. i Västervik 12, studiex. 17, stud. v. Gbgs högsk. 24. Medarb). i Västerv.-Posten 19-24, medarb. i Västerv.-Tidn. 30, red:sekr. fr. 3’1. Presskomim. v. Västerviksutst. 33. Styr :led. o. sekr. i Tjustbygd. kulturhist. fören., int. v. dess museum i Västervik 30-43’, sekr. i insaml:- o. restaurer :komm. f. S :ta Gertruds kyrka, förest, i. föreläsn iför-en. 39, styr :led. i Västerv. konstfören. Utg. ett flert. skr. av lokalhist. intr., minnesskr., kulturhist. data, Gunnebo Bruk 1764-1939, Norsholm-Västervik-Hultsfreds järnv. 1’879-1944, Ankars-rums b ruk (33 ), Ö ve rum s bruk (3’1) m. m. Medl. av Publ :kl., av Frimurarorden, Sällsk. Vegagillet, ÖM i Odd Fellow nr 2S Orion 3’S-38.
translated:
Åkerman, Karl Helge, editor|secretary, Västervik, b. 17/12/96 in Västervik to Carl Å. and Kristina Andersdotter. Married on 26 with Eva Risberg. Children: Karl b. 27, Petter b. 28, Kristina b. 31, Elisabet b. 42, Nils b. 44, Lars b. 47. 
Attended Realskolan in Västervik until 1912, graduated in 1917, studied at Gothenburg University 1924. Collaborated in Västervik Posten from 1919-1924, collaborated in Västervik Tidningen from 1930, and became editor-secretary from 1931. Press commissioner at the Västerviks Exhibition in 1933. Serves as board member and secretary in Tjustbygd cultural historical association, involved with its museum in Västervik from 1930 to 1943, secretary in the fundraising and restoration committee for St. Gertrud's Church, chaired lectures for an association in 1939, and serves as a board member of Västervik Art Society. Published several works on local history interests, commemorative writings, cultural historical data, Gunnebo Ironworks 1764-1939, Norsholm-Västervik-Hultsfred railway 1879-1944, Ankarsrum Ironworks (1933), Överums Ironworks (1934), and more. Member of the Publishing Club, Freemasonry, Vegagillet Society, and Odd Fellow Lodge Orion no. 38 from 1935 to 1938.
